entry.def: An oddity is someone or something that is very strange.

example.ex: Losing my hair made me feel an oddity...
example.tran: 脱发使我觉得自己是个怪人。

example.ex: Carlson noticed another oddity; his plant had bloomed twice.
example.tran: 卡尔森注意到另外一件怪事：他的植物开了两次花。

entry.def: The oddity of something is the fact that it is very strange.

example.ex: ...the oddities of the Welsh legal system.
example.tran: 威尔士法律体系的奇特之处

means.word_mean: 1. eccentricity that is not easily explained
3. something unusual -- perhaps worthy of collecting

sentences.en: From his weird behaviour, he seems a bit of an oddity.
sentences.cn: 从他不寻常的行为看来,他好像有点怪。

sentences.en: I noticed the oddity of his behaviour.
sentences.cn: 我注意到他的行为古怪。

sentences.en: Even today a man who stays at home to look after the children is regarded as something of an oddity.
sentences.cn: 即使在今天人们仍然认为在家照看孩子的男人是个怪人。
